title: Tim Merlier sprints to victory on stage 2 of the Giro d’Italia
content:
Tim Merlier (Alpecin-Fenix) took his first career Grand Tour stage victory on Sunday’s stage 2 of the Giro d’Italia.

The 179 km stage from Stupingi to Novara came down to a bunch kick, where lead-out riders from Cofidis and UAE-Team Emirates led the way into the last few hundred meters. A well-positioned Merlier surged past with 200 meters and one final curve in the road to go before the line.

Giacomo Nizzolo (Qhubeka-Assos) jumped on Merlier’s wheel with Dylan Groenewegen (Jumbo-Visma) and then Elia Viviani (Cofidis) behind him, but Merlier held off his rivals to take a clear win at the line. Nizzolo settled for second with Groenewegen taking third on the day.

Filippo Ganna (Ineos Grenadiers) finished safely in the pack to retain his overall race lead.

Giro d'Italia (2.UWT) Stupinigi → Novara
author: Dane Cash
